description: Set the seed for the random-number generator. By default i = 10,000. The value specified should be of the same magnitude as the default value. If the model random keyword is given after a model new command, identical models can be generated for multiple runs. The seed is not reset by the model new command. The value of the random-number seed is emitted into the record, so the record can be used to exactly recreate the original model.
notes: Specified value should be of same magnitude as default (around 10,000)
Seed is NOT reset by 'model new' command - persists across model resets
Use after 'model new' to generate identical models for multiple runs
Random seed value is emitted into the state record
Record can be used to exactly recreate the original model
Important for reproducible research and debugging
Same seed + same operations = identical results (if deterministic mode on)

examples.description: Set random seed to default value (10,000)
Set random seed to custom value for reproducibility

examples.command:
model new
model random 10000
ball generate number 1000 radius 0.5
examples.description: Reset model, set seed, generate balls - will produce identical positions each run

examples.command:
model random 54321
model deterministic on
ball generate number 500 radius gaussian mean 0.5 deviation 0.1
examples.description: Set seed and deterministic mode for fully reproducible generation

examples.command:
; Run 1
model new
model random 99999
ball generate number 1000 radius 0.5 box -10 10
model save 'run1.sav'

; Run 2 (identical to Run 1)
model new
model random 99999
ball generate number 1000 radius 0.5 box -10 10
model save 'run2.sav'
examples.description: Two runs with same seed produce identical ball distributions

examples.command:
model random 20000
fish define gen_random_props
  loop local i (1, ball.num)
    local bp = ball.find(i)
    ball.dens(bp) = math.random.uniform * 1000 + 1500
  endloop
end
gen_random_props
examples.description: Set seed before using FISH random functions for reproducibility
